org.epochx.tools.grammar
Class GrammarProduction

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.tools.grammar.GrammarProduction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class GrammarProduction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

One of potentially multiple options that a GrammarRule can resolve to. It contains a sequence of one or more GrammarNodes that together produce a valid mapping for the left-hand side of a grammar rule as represented by GrammarRule instances.

          Constructs a production with no GrammarNodes.

Constructor Detail

GrammarProduction

public GrammarProduction(java.util.List<GrammarNode> grammarNodes)
Constructs a production around the specified sequence of GrammarNodes.

Parameters:
grammarNodes - a List of GrammarNodes that provides the mapping sequence for this production.

GrammarProduction

public GrammarProduction()
Constructs a production with no GrammarNodes. A valid production should have one or more GrammarNodes so one or more should be added to this GrammarProduction before use.

See Also:
addGrammarNode(GrammarNode)
Method Detail

addGrammarNode

public void addGrammarNode(GrammarNode node)
Appends the specified symbol to the list of GrammarNodes in this production.

Parameters:
node - the rule or literal to be appended to this production.
See Also:
setGrammarNode(int, GrammarNode)

getGrammarNodes

public java.util.List<GrammarNode> getGrammarNodes()
Returns a list of the rules and literals that make up this production, in the order that they resolve to.

Returns:
the sequence of GrammarNodes that make up this production.

getGrammarNode

public GrammarNode getGrammarNode(int index)
Returns the GrammarNode at the specified index in the sequence of rules and literals in this production.

Returns:
the GrammarNode at the specified index in this production.

setGrammarNode

public void setGrammarNode(int index,
                           GrammarNode node)
Set the GrammarNode at the specified index, overwriting the current occupant.

Parameters:
index - the index of the current GrammarNode to be replaced.
node - the new GrammarNode to place at the specified index in this production.
See Also:
addGrammarNode(GrammarNode)

getNoGrammarNodes

public int getNoGrammarNodes()
Returns the quantity of GrammarNodes in this production.

Returns:
the number of GrammarNodes in this production.

getAttribute

public java.lang.Object getAttribute(java.lang.String key)
Retrieves the value of the attribute with the given key. If no attribute with that key exists then null is returned. Currently all values that were parsed from a String grammar will be returned here as String objects. In future versions this may change to parse the values into more suitable Object types.

Parameters:
key - the key that identifies the attribute value to return.
Returns:
the Object value of the attribute with the given key, or null if no attributes with that key exist on this GrammarProduction.

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.Object value)
Sets the value of the attribute with the given key. If no attribute with that key exists then a new one will be created, if one does exist then it will be overwritten with the new value.

Parameters:
key - the unique key of the attribute to set.
value - an value of any Object type to store as an attribute under the given key.

getAttributeKeys

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAttributeKeys()
Retrieve the Set of attribute keys that have been set for this production.

Returns:
a Set of all attribute keys that have been set for this production. If no attributes have been set then an empty set will be returned.

getMinDepth

public int getMinDepth()
Calculates and returns the minimum depth required resolve this production to all GrammarLiteral nodes. The minimum depth of a production is the largests of all the minimum depths of its GrammarNodes.

Returns:
the minimum depth required to resolve to all GrammarLiteral nodes.

isRecursive

public boolean isRecursive()
Determines whether this production is recursive. A production is recursive if any of its nodes that are rules (rather than literals) are recursive.

Returns:
true if this production is has a GrammarRule that is recursive and false otherwise.

clone

public GrammarProduction clone()
Returns a copy of this production which is a new instance of GrammarProduction with the same set of grammar nodes and attributes.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a GrammarProduction which is a copy of this production.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this production and its grammar nodes.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a string representation of this production.
